title: Man guilty of murdering his best mate after sleeping with his wife and burying him in a bush grave
text:
A Tasmanian woman and her one-time lover have been found guilty of murdering her tattoo-artist husband in a 'cold and calculated' killing.

Dwayne 'Doc' Davies, 47, was shot in the back and head by 43-year-old Bradley Scott Purkiss after being lured to a property in the rural southeast Tasmanian town of Elderslie on May 26, 2017.

A Hobart Supreme Court jury on Monday found Purkiss guilty of murder, as well as Mr Davies' wife Margaret Anne Otto, 47, who wasn't there when her husband was killed but helped plan his death.

'The crime was a cold, calculated execution,' crown prosecutor Madeleine Wilson told the court during sentencing submissions.

Margaret Anne Otto (pictured with her late husband Dwayne 'Doc' Davies) was found guilty of murdering Davies after helping to plan his death

Mr Davies was invited to Elderslie by his friend Purkiss to inspect Harley-Davidson motorcycles.

There he was shot twice at close range in a shed before Purkiss buried his body in a shallow bush grave at nearby Levendale.

It was exhumed more than a week later by police.

Purkiss and Otto had an affair the year before the murder.

Mr Davies was killed on the day of his grandson's first birthday, which was attended by Otto who kept up a ruse that her husband was missing.

Mr Davies and Otto were in a 20-year relationship.

Dwayne 'Doc' Davies (pictured) had been in a relationship with Ms Otto for 20 years

In a written statement read out to the court, Mr Davies' sister Kelly Goss said Otto was considered part of the family.

'It's impossible to conceive, Dwayne loved Margaret so much,' it read.

'Now I don't know what's real and what's not.'

Otto's lawyer, Greg Melick, told the court she was scared to leave her husband, who was abusive and forced her to have sex with other men and that his drug habit was sending their family bankrupt.

Mr Melick said Otto thought Mr Davies would receive a warning and she never contemplated murder.

Purkiss and Otto are expected to be sentenced on Wednesday.

'My son was no saint or no angel but he was my son and I loved him very much,' Mr Davies father Glen Davies told the court.
description: Margaret Anne Otto and Bradley Scott Purkiss have been found guilty of murdering Hobart tattoo artist Dwayne 'Doc' Davies, who was shot in the back and head.
